--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Davor Cengija <java-junit@m...> wrote:
> chaz wrote:
> 
> > Hi,
> >   I'm experencing the following error below, when I try to use the
> > swing or awt ui of TestRunner. Could someone please help to correct
> > this error. I'm using Redhat 7.3 and JUnit 3.8.1, and was just running
> > the AllTests sample that came with JUnit.
> > 
> > 
> > Exception in thread "main" java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError:
> > /usr/java/j2sdk1.4.1_01/jre/lib/i386/libfontmanager.so:
> > libstdc++-libc6.1-1.so.2: cannot open shared object file: No such file
> > or directory
> 
> This is a basic JDK installation problem and has nothing to do with
JUnit's 
> test runner. You'll probably have the same error while trying to run
any 
> java GUI. Read the JDK 1.4.1 installation guide, especially its 
> requirements section.
> 
> But, while we're already here, it looks like you don't have the correct 
> libstdc++ installed (or it might be installed in a non-standard way).
> 
> run
> ldd /usr/java/j2sdk1.4.1_01/jre/lib/i386/libfontmanager.so
> 
> and you should get something like 
> 
> libstdc++-libc6.1-1.so.2 => /usr/lib/libstdc++-libc6.1-1.so.2
(0x400f0000)
> (also listed some other libraries).
> 
> libstdc++-libc6.1-1.so.2 is in libstdc++2.10-2.96-0.76mdk package,
at least 
> on Mandrake 8.2.
> 
> davor@lothar ~ $ rpm -qf /usr/lib/libstdc++-libc6.1-1.so.2
> libstdc++2.10-2.96-0.76mdk
> 
> Redhat 7.3 should have a similar file and it should be in /usr/lib.
> 
> So, if you don't have libstdc++ installed, install it. If you do
have it 
> installed, then check if you have /usr/lib in /etc/ld.so.conf. If
not, add 
> it and run ldconfig. If it still doesn't work, check that libstdc++ is 
> installed correctly, e.g. all the simbolic links are created correctly. 
> Here's what I have
> 
> davor@lothar /usr/lib $ ls -l libstdc++-*
> -rw-r--r--    1 root     root       452342 Feb 21  2002 
> libstdc++-3-libc6.2-2-2.10.0.a
> -r-xr-xr-x    1 root     root       299756 Feb 21  2002 
> libstdc++-3-libc6.2-2-2.10.0.so*
> lrwxrwxrwx    1 root     root           24 Jul 21 22:56 
> libstdc++-libc6.1-1.so.2 -> libstdc++-libc6.2-2.so.3*
> lrwxrwxrwx    1 root     root           30 Jul 25 07:46 
> libstdc++-libc6.2-2.a.3 -> libstdc++-3-libc6.2-2-2.10.0.a
> lrwxrwxrwx    1 root     root           31 Jul 21 22:56 
> libstdc++-libc6.2-2.so.3 -> libstdc++-3-libc6.2-2-2.10.0.so*
> 
> -- 
> davor.cengija@m...
Hi,
  Just wanted to take the time to thank you for your help, I was
missing the symbolic link for the libstdc++-libc6.1-1.so.2. Once I
place it in the /usr/lib directory TestRunner for swing worked fine.

cheers,

chaz
